PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A COURTESY POST ONLY. Lady Bug is in a private foster home, and is not adoptable through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you are interested in Lady Bug, please contact her foster mom directly at stephanierichard@me.com. She is located in Astoria in Queens, NY. Small adoption fee applies.

Meet Lady Bug! This gorgeous brindle pittie was found living in a car, left alone, before being saved by her foster. Super smart, Lady Bug already knows many commands, including 'sit', 'stay', 'come', 'lay', and also understands that when you tell her 'no' it means to stop doing something...and she actually stops! Oh, and she's housetrained! A huge people lover, this sweet girl wants nothing more than a forever family to cuddle up with and show her what it feels like to really be loved. While we think she'll be great in most any home, she's not the biggest fan of small dogs, so a home where she can be an only dog-child. Can you give her the forever home she's been waiting for? Then email stephanierichard@me.com!

Please VISIT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE AND WEBSITE for the latest Social Tees news! Facebook.com/SocialTeesAnimalRescue and Socialteesnyc.org FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM @socialteesnyc

King is a total lover 5 years old with some abandonment issues. He is more of a ladies man, but warms up to men with time.  He loves attention but is somewhat like a cat; he wants it when he wants it. With time and lots of patience, King is super loyal and loving.

He has some handling sensitivities. For example, he needs to be professionally groomed.  He loves being outdoors,  is  great with other dogs and loves socializing, but would probably do best as the only-pet or one other dog. He shouldnât be left alone for long periods of time â that is when another dog would definitely help his abandonment issues.

Crackers is such a lovely little guy! He is about 3 years old and 10 lbs, and he's got a gorgeous yellow coat with long delicate legs. He must have come from a  rough background and can be quite shy at first, but he's a wonderful little boy once he warms up.He adores being in your lap, and he's good with other dogs that he knows but can be a little afraid/choosy with new dogs at first. He would do best in a quiet grownups only home with someone who has the patience to give this boy the chance he deserves to open up and blossom into the amazing dog he's meant to be! His foster mom says: âCrackers is doing great! He's such a good boy!  I'd say he's really just working at standard things for warming up to a new home. Heâs okay with most people, just a little shaky if we sneak up on him too quickly.  He's very affectionate toward us and and especially loves my husband.  He likes to lay on the couch with us and watch TV.  He gets super excited to see us when we get home and in the mornings, etc.  I'm trying to remember how he is with meeting new  people, but he's really just been around us and people walking by with dogs.  He did meet my parents once but I can't remember the initial meet, no concerns though. He may need a little help warming up to other dogs. He is very interested in other dogs and when they approach from a distance he'll stop and watch them. When they approach up close he's still interested because he moves forward rather than backward, then at the same time has tale between legs, shakes and growls like heâs afraid. He and Lilee, my dog, are doing good together though, he's never been afraid of her not even on day 1 (Lilee's pretty polite and mild tempered when meeting dogs).  They both fetch (we didn't teach him, he knew how on his own). During walks he is a little shaky on the leash at certain times like around loud noises, But, with a quick command he goes and even moves at a great pace when we are all moving together. Heâs totally housebroken, only one accident in the house (first night), heâs also crate trained. Heâs super quiet and never barks. All in all, he's a really wonderful boy :)â

PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A COURTESY POST ONLY. Lady Bug is in a private foster home, and is not adoptable through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you are interested in Lucy, please contact Michael at michael@michaeltsmith.net or Camp Canine at campcanineny@gmail.com.

Meet Lucy! Lucy is 4 year old, 35lbs mini pittie! Lucy loves being near her people at all times and has to be touching you. She is such a little bundle of love. She also is the best Netflix and chill buddy since she can be a little bit of a couch potato at times. Lucy is a great, sweet, loving dog who is just overly anxious in the city. Oddly she hasn't really had issues with fireworks or thunderstorms... just loud city noise. When on her quiet street or in her apartment, she's totally fine. But when walking on a busy street (like an avenue here in the city) she gets anxious really fast. This means she gets really reactive and defensive (she has gone through multiple trainings and such to help her get over this but it seems this sweet girl is just not meant to be a city girl). Because of this, Lucy is looking for a loving home in a quieter area, preferably the suburbs. Her ideal home would be in a quieter area with happy adults who will give her time to get over her initial timidness since once she warms up to you she is the biggest lovebug ever. Lucy gets along with most other dogs, is fully vetted and spayed. 

If interested in learning more about Lucy, please Contact Michael at michael@michaeltsmith.net or campcanineny@gmail.com

How adorable is this pup? 13 weeks old, 15lbs of pure souther charm, this baby is well socialized, is super smart and learning to use the bathroom outside and will grow to be a medium sized hound btw 55-65lbs. An active home with a hound lover would be the best fit- ADORALBE! we cant stand the cuteness

UNO is an 8 year old Chiweenie boy, that weighs 10lbs. He is blind in one eye, after severe abuse and trauma to his head. but this cannot stop this boy. and crazy enough- he loves loves loves people. this guy is great with dogs, low maintenance and gets along with everyone. He is pretty much perfect, housebroken and super sweet and affectionate. We are going to get the remains of his eye removed, as he cant see anyways- so not only will he be super cute, he is going to be the cutest one eyed bandit you'll ever meet- APPLY now to adopt this GEM of a dog

Loki is an adorable 2 year old terrier mix arriving in NYC on October 22 from a high kill shelter in Alabama. This sweet boy was dropped at the shelter heartworm positive, but he is going through treatment and will be ready for adoption when he arrives. Looking for a forever family to cuddle with, play with, and share all of his love with, apply now to give this cutie the home he's been waiting for!

Loki is fixed, up to date on all of his medical, and full grown at 18 pounds.

This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 3 days of receiving your application!

Ace is a gorgeous 8 year old purebred black lab arriving in NYC on October 22. Ace was bought from a breeder as a pup and for reasons we simply can't understand he ended up in a high kill shelter in Alabama. Ace is as perfect as dogs come--calm, sweet, loving, and absolutely handsome! If you're looking to add a new family member to your home then look no further than Ace!

Ace is up to date on all of his medical, fixed, and full grown at 70 pounds.

MOLLY is a sweet 1/1.5 year old Blue Heeler.  Here is a little bio from her foster mama:

Molly is an amazing dog. She is extremely smart and has a wonderful disposition. She is obedient and understands "no", "sit" and is picking up "wait" when our other dogs are getting treats so she waits her turn. We caught her taking a blanket from one of the dog crates into her own. Can't express how uniquely smart she is. Her potential with the right family is endless.

She doesn't bark even when we have our poodles barking. She sits politely before going out at the door and walks without pulling. She wasn't going pee outside no matter how many times we took her out but now with just one day in PA, she's learned that's where she has to go. She's great with other dogs and just wants to play with them. She has no food or treat aggression. We are able to pet her while she eats and she's quickly learned to release toys from her mouth if you tell her. She should definitely be in a home with at least a medium activity level. She's a sweetheart and enjoys being cradled and of course a good belly rub. Molly is starting to form a beautiful bond with Buster and we only wish we could keep her.

It seems impossible, but this absurdly adorable striped Shih Tzu has been up for adoption for over a year. Mabel is a gentle, kind, affectionate, and grateful girl that is easy going, low energy, and wonderful with other animals... the "catch" is, she is about 12 years old, partially blind, and diabetic. We know, it sounds like a problem package, but she's actually a very easy girl and just needs a specific diet, daily insulin injections (which she takes like a champ!), and occasional vet checkups. She gets around well as long as she has a little guidance. Mabel is in an awesome foster home that nursed her from a bald bag of bones (when we originally rescued her) back to a healthy fluffy senior -- NOW, she needs a forever home where she can live out her golden years napping in someone's lap, ideally with another dog in the home too as she just loves to cuddle with her foster doggy siblings. Her foster mom says: "Mabel is the sweetest golden girl and has been by far our favorite foster! She gets along great with everyone she meets from dogs, to cats, and humans of all ages! She has a very calm and sweet temperament with some cute old lady sass here and there! She enjoys lots of cuddles with humans and her foster siblings (especially with our pittie). Sometimes she will do this cute little whimper when she needs some cuddle time. She loves to eat and get lots of treats! Mabel also enjoys short walks and lounging around on soft surfaces (or blue ikea bags haha). Her special needs care is super easy with her positive attitude. She takes eyedrops daily (to help with her dry eye) and patiently waits for her daily insulin shots after her meals (even looks forward to them since it means treat time!). She is partially blind, but navigates very well. Mabel would really benefit from a home that is low key, has another dog to cuddle with and that will spoil her with love she deserves! She is a true gem of a little lady that can't wait to meet you!" Interested in adopting? Submit an application at socialteesnyc.org!

Holy cuteness! Robert Taylor is the cutest chunky monkey! 5 years old of all tail wags and happiness. He loves dogs, cats and is amazing with all people. If you want to add a very special little fella to your family look no further!

FOSTER UPDATE: Kasey is being fostered with two other dogs and he's loving life! Spending his day playing with the other dogs, we know that Kase will be great in any home...even if that home has a canine sibling for him. He also loves every single person he meets and is always ready to provide lots of love through big wet kisses. With a smile always on his face, Kasey is sure to light up any home. Oh, and he has that smart lab brain meaning he's already mastered some commands and is open to learning many more! His foster mom says that he is just an absolute joy to be around because he has the sweetest and most loving personality!

-------------------------------

Meet Kasey! This gorgeous 1 year old lab mix arrived in NYC on August 13 from a high kill shelter in Alabama. A happy, loving boy with the sweetest smile you've ever seen, Kasey is sure to be an amazing new addition to any home. Apply now and make his dreams of finding a forever home come true!

This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 3 days of receiving your application!
